Lela Munnell SOLT was born on 21 SEP 1902 in Callaway, Custer County, Nebraska. She appeared in the census in 1910 in Comstock, Custer County, Nebraska. (living at home with father and mother.) She died on 16 APR 1999 at Sargent, Custer County, Nebraska.

Lincoln County, Nebraska

Lela Munnell

SARGENT - Lela Munnell, 96, of Sargent, formerly of Brewster, died April 16, 1999, at the Goli Medical Center in Sargent.

She was born Sept. 21, 1902, near Callaway to John H. and Alice Colby Solt. She grew up and attended school in the Callaway area.

On June 30, 1928, she married Charles B. Munnell at North Platte. In March 1939, the couple moved to a ranch southeast of Brewster, where they made their home.

In 1964, she moved to Sargent. She spent many years taking care of elderly people in their homes. In May 1998, she entered the Goli Medical Center. Survivors include 10 grandchildren and 13 great-grandchildren.

She was preceded in death by her husband in July 1963; an infant daughter; two sons, Carl and Franklin; her parents; two sisters; and three brothers.

Services will be at 10:30 a.m. Thursday at the Pleasant Valley Gospel Church near Brewster with the Rev. Don Schauda officiating. Burial will be in the Brewster Cemetery.

Visitation will be from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. Wednesday at Govier Brothers Mortuary in Broken Bow.

Parents: John H. SOLT and Alice Josephine COLBY.

Spouse: Charles B. MUNNELL. Charles B. MUNNELL and Lela Munnell SOLT were married on 30 JUN 1928 in Callaway, Custer County, Nebraska.

Angela Frances SOUKUP was born on 27 APR 1916 in Jackson, Jackson County, Minnesota. She died on 6 MAY 2002 at Fridley, Anoka County, Minnesota.

Angela F. (Soukup) Colby

Colby Angela F. (Soukup), age 86, of Fridley, passed away May 6. She was preceded in death by her loving husband of 47 years, Woodrow Colby. She was a member of the Eagles Aerie #3718 for 50 years. Survived by her loving family: James (Yvonne) Colby, Jean (Fran) Faymoville, Sandy (Joe) Cogger; 12 grandchildren, 9 great-grandchildren. She fought a courageous battle with cancer, but her spirits always remained high. She will be sadly missed by her family and friends. Mass of Christian Burial 10 am Friday, May 10 at Immaculate Conception Catholic Church, 4030 Jackson St. NE, Col. Hts (763-788-9062). Visitation 4-8 pm Thursday evening at the Miller Funeral Home, 6210 NE Hwy 65, Fridley, and one hour prior to Mass Friday in church. Parish prayer service 7 pm, New Brighton Eagles Ritual 7:30 pm Thursday, both in funeral chapel. Interment Morningside Memorial Gardens, Coon Rapids. Memorials preferred to American Cancer Society Miller Funeral Home Fridley Chapel 763-571-1300

Published in the Minneapolis Star Tribune on 5/8/2002.

Spouse: Woodrow Wilson COLBY. Woodrow Wilson COLBY and Angela Frances SOUKUP were married about 1954.
